page.title: 14Local customs in Evie
page.content: Started in the days of horse power, the local{Ploughing Match}is still a big event although tractors are now used. At night an amusing prize giving and dance is held. The{Parish Picnic}is held annually and is a day out for the family. Races are held for all ages. {Halloween}is still a time for neepy lanterns but the traditional mischief worked now tends to go too far. {Weddings:}Before getting married the bride usually has a{'henny night'}out with the lasses while as the groom has a{'stag night'}with the boys. Both are usually{'blackened'}some time before they are married. Weddings are evening affairs and can go on all night. A wooden{'brides cog'}full of hot or cold brew is passed around the guests. {Traditional dances}are still danced at weddings and{Harvest Home}dances.
